title: Investments in climate adaptation should be an integral part of the trans-European transport network, study shows
description: A new study that shows how all transport modes on the TEN-T network will be exposed to significantly more climate extremes in the future.

title: EU introduces Flight Emissions Label for more informed and sustainable travelling
description: The Commission adopted a Regulation putting in place a Flight Emissions Label (FEL), which offers a clear and trustworthy methodology for calculating flight emissions.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – November 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: New study published on Greening of European sea ports
description: New study published on Greening of European sea ports

title: December infringements package: key decisions
description: December infringements package: key decisions

title: New rules for better cross-border enforcement of traffic laws
description: The Commission welcomes the European Parliament and Council's final adoption of the Directive to strengthen cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules.

title: Transforming cross-border traffic in Central Europe with ITS
description: Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) are designed to monitor, evaluate, and manage transportation networks to improve safety and efficiency.

title: Commission updates EU Air Safety List and adds Air Tanzania to the airlines banned within the European Union
description: The Commission updated the EU Air Safety List, the list of airlines that are subject to an operating ban or operational restrictions within the European Union, because they do not meet international safety standards.

title: Commission welcomes the updated European ATM Master Plan
description: The Commission welcomes the updated European air traffic management (ATM) Master Plan, adopted at the Governing Board meeting of the SESAR 3 Joint Undertaking.

title: Single European Sky Regulation enters into force, aiming for a more efficient and sustainable airspace
description: The new Single European Sky (SES2+) Regulation entered into force, in a step forward towards a more efficient, and more sustainable European airspace.

title: Coordinated Romania-Moldova border controls to facilitate EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes transit
description: A Memorandum of Understanding on coordinated border checks at the Galați-Giurgiulești crossing between Romania and Moldova was signed today, paving the way for a faster transit of goods along the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – October 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: 2024 Excellence in Road Safety Awards: European Commission rewards top road safety initiatives
description: The Commission announced the winners of the 2024 Excellence in Road Safety Awards, organised by the European Road Safety Charter.

title: November infringements package: key decisions
description: November infringements package: key decisions

title: EU and Philippines team up to boost seafarers’ training, certification and labor conditions
description: The EU and the Government of the Philippines have launched a Technical Assistance Project to improve seafarers' training, education and working conditions in the Philippines.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – September 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: 20,400 lives lost in EU road crashes last year
description: In 2023, 20,400 people lost their lives in road crashes across the EU, marking a 1% decrease from the previous year, with 46 road deaths per million inhabitants.

title: October infringements package: key decisions
description: In its regular package of infringement decisions, the European Commission pursues legal action against Member States for failing to comply with their obligations under EU law.

title: Single European Sky: annual monitoring highlights persistent capacity shortages and failure to meet environmental targets in 2023, as traffic recovers
description: The Performance Review Body (PRB) has published the 2023 Annual Monitoring Report and Traffic Light System - part of its yearly review of how Single European Sky (SES) Member States are performing.

title: Women in Rail 2024 Award to boost female talent for a sustainable and competitive rail industry
description: The Commission together with Europe’s Rail Joint Undertaking and the EU Agency for Railways celebrated the Women in Rail 2024 Award.

title: Commission seeks feedback on the Flight Emissions Label
description: The Commission has launched a public consultation on the draft proposal establishing the EU Flight Emissions Label.

title: CEF Transport: €2.5 billion to boost resilience and safety across the EU transport network
description: The 2024 CEF for Transport call for proposals makes €2.5 billion available for projects that will modernise transport infrastructure on the EU’s TEN-T network, and in Ukraine and Moldova.

title: Rail market opening: competition leads to lower ticket prices, EU study finds
description: A study released by the European Commission highlights the user benefits of competition in both passenger rail and rail freight services.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – August 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: European Mobility Week kicks off to promote shared public spaces for sustainable urban mobility and improved quality of life
description: The European Mobility Week, an annual event promoting sustainable urban mobility with over 2,500 cities and towns participating in a week-long festival from 16 to 22 September.

title: TEN-T Corridor Coordinators
description: Nine European Coordinators have been designated today to help complete the trans-European transport network (TEN-T), a vast infrastructure network of railways, roads, and inland waterways connecting the European Union.

title: Sustainable Transport Forum - new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and public key infrastructure for e-mobility
description: In the wake of the adoption of the new Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), the European Commission has set up three new sub-groups under the Sustainable Transport Forum (STF) expert group.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – July 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: Commission enforces temporary restrictions on liquid screening at certain EU airports
description: The Commission will temporarily enforce restrictions on liquid screening at EU airports utilising Explosive Detection Systems for Cabin Baggage (EDSCB).

title: European Commission launches Ship Financing Portal to boost the maritime sector's green transition
description: The Ship Financing Portal, designed to improve access to financing for the shipping sector and the wider maritime industry, is now online!

title: July infringement package: key decisions
description: July infringement package: key decisions

title: FuelEU Maritime Regulation: Q&A on implementation
description: As the maritime sector prepares for the FuelEU Maritime Regulation, a new Commission document answers key questions on its implementation.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – June 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: Commission publishes new guidelines for more clarity on air passenger rights
description: While more citizens of the European Union are aware of their EU passenger rights than was the case five years ago, the majority do not consider that they have enough information, according to the results of a Eurobarometer survey released today.

title: EU invests record €7 billion in sustainable, safe and smart transport infrastructure
description: The Commission has selected 134 projects to receive over €7 billion in EU grants from the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF), the EU's programme for investment in transport infrastructure.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – May 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: EU and ICAO strengthen commitment to global aviation safety, security, and sustainability
description: The EU and the ICAO have reaffirmed their commitment to enhancing global aviation safety, security, and sustainability during a meeting at ICAO Headquarters in Montreal on 26 June.

title: New EU Transport Report: Current trends and issues
description: The European Commission has released an overview of the latest developments in the EU transport sector, highlighting trends and issues for both the EU and individual Member States.

title: EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: EU-funded scanners increase capacity at Hungarian-Ukrainian border
description: A new EU-funded mobile cargo scanner was delivered today to the border crossing point in Chop at the Hungarian-Ukrainian border, in a bid to improve the flow of trade across Ukraine’s borders. Valued at approximately €2.5 million, the donation is part of the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

title: Urban public transport – New set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
description: The Commission’s Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted recommendations on complementing public transport with shared mobility, and on using the Social Climate Fund to support public transport.

title: Europeans are generally positive towards e-mobility
description: A large survey by the European Alternative Fuels Observatory (EAFO) in twelve EU Member States shows a positive attitude towards switching to battery-electric cars.

title: EU and Ukraine update and extend Road Transport Agreement
description: The EU and Ukraine decided today to prolong and update their current road transport Agreement. Implemented due to lost transport routes and export markets east of Ukraine caused by the Russian aggression, the agreement supports the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

title: A sustainable and resilient transport network bringing Europe closer together
description: The Commission welcomes the final adoption of the Regulation underpinning the trans-European transport network (TEN-T) by the European Parliament and the Council.

title: European Union signs aviation agreement with the People's Republic of Bangladesh
description: The European Union and Bangladesh have signed a Horizontal Aviation Agreement

title: May infringements package: key decisions
description: May infringements package: key decisions

title: Two years of Solidarity Lanes have brought the EU, Ukraine and Moldova closer together
description: Two years ago, in May 2022, the Commission, in collaboration with Ukraine and Moldova, created the Solidarity Lanes to help improve the EU–Ukraine–Moldova transport routes in response to Russia’s illegal full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: Solidarity Lanes: improving the Danube routes together
description: Representatives of Moldova, Romania, Ukraine, the United States  and the European Commission gathered today in Chisinau, continuing their work together to improve trade routes through the Solidarity Lanes along the Danube corridor.

title: EU supports improved Ukrainian–Moldovan border crossing cooperation as part of Solidarity Lanes
description: Today the European Commission, together with Ukraine, Moldova, Romania and the US are inaugurating the renewed Ukrainian-Moldovan border crossing point in Reni, Ukraine, as part of the Solidarity Lanes initiative.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – April 2024
description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: Commission adopts reasoned opinion in case brought by Italy against Austria on road transport
description: The Commission today adopted a reasoned opinion in a procedure brought by Italy against Austria under Article 259 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.

title: Excellence in Road Safety Awards 2024: applications now open
description: Today, the European Road Safety Charter, the largest civil platform dedicated to road safety and led by the European Commission, opened applications for the 2024 Excellence in Road Safety Awards.

title: April infringement package: key decisions
description: April infringement package: key decisions

title: Urban Vehicle Access Regulations (UVARs) – recommendations by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility
description: The Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted its recommendations on Urban Vehicle Access Regulations .

title: Commission and EU rail sector launch Women in Rail Award 2024
description: The award, divided into three categories, aims to promote fairness, diversity, and equality, and to celebrate outstanding and inspiring women and their achievements in the rail sector.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – March 2024
description: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

title: Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation: Q&A on operating recharging infrastructure
description: The Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), comes into force on 13 April 2024, supporting the transition towards more sustainable transport by setting obligatory targets for the rollout of recharging and refuelling transport infrastructure.

title: EU boosts zero-emission mobility with over €424 million in funding for 42 projects
description: The Commission is announcing the selection of 42 new projects deploying alternative fuels infrastructure that will receive over €424 million in EU support.

title: Commission paves way for safe integration of ‘air taxis' and other innovative drone uses
description: The Commission adopted a set of measures to address the unique safety challenges of new emerging air mobility concepts and services and ensure that their operations will be as safe as those in manned aviation.

title: New interactive page showcases positive impact of CEF Transport
description: As part of the activities linked to the tenth anniversary of the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Programme, CINEA launched a new interactive web-page to showcase the contribution of the CEF for Transport Programme to greening and decarbonising the transport sector.

title: EU institutions commit to boost cycling across Europe
description: The EU is taking another important step in reducing transport emissions by adopting the European Declaration on Cycling

title: Participatory conference on labour market developments and labour shortages in the transport sector in the European Union
description: The Commission organises a participatory conference to enable discussions with and between relevant stakeholders on labour market developments

title: Call for applications for the selection of members of the European ITS Advisory Group
description: The Commission’s Directorate-General for Mobility and Transport has launched a call for applications to select new members of the European ITS Advisory Group

title: Commissioner Vălean kicks off the Connecting Europe Days
description: The Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean, is participating in the four-day Connecting Europe Days taking place in Brussels from 2 to 5 April 2024

title: EU and Moldova extend Road Transport Agreement until 31 December 2025
description: The EU and Moldova decided today to extend the validity of their current road transport Agreement until 31 December 2025. The Agreement aims at helping Moldova access world markets by facilitating transit through EU countries and also further developing its links with the EU market.

title: EU and Ukraine continue strengthening Solidarity Lanes and cooperation on connectivity, safety and sustainability of transport
description: The third high-level meeting of the EU-Ukraine Transport Dialogue took place yesterday in Kyiv, focusing on efforts to keep Ukraine's exports and imports moving via the Solidarity Lanes, improving connectivity, safety and security as well as sustainability.

title: Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime, 8 March 2024
description: The Belgian EU Presidency hosted the 'Conference on the Wellbeing of Seafarers' on International Women’s Day, March 8, 2024, featuring the 'Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime' award ceremony.

title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – February 2024
description: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

title: Budapest and online platform Nudgd recognised for green mobility activities in the European urban mobility awards
description: Budapest was awarded the European Mobility Week Award in a ceremony in Brussels last night, while online platform Nudgd won the Mobility Action award.

title: March infringements package: key decisions
description: March infringements package: key decisions

title: Provisional agreement on better cross-border enforcement of road safety traffic rules
description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on facilitating the enforcement of road traffic rules across borders.

title: 2023 figures show stalling progress in reducing road fatalities in too many countries
description: Road safety in the EU 2023: Around 20 400 people were killed in road crashes last year, a small 2% decrease on 2022.

title: Save the date for the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards!
description: This April, the European Commission, together with Europe’s Rail, the European Union Agency for Railways, CER, UNIFE and ALE will launch the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards.

title: Commission proposes to prolong road transport agreements with Ukraine and Moldova and introduces updates to the agreement with Ukraine
description: The proposals, sent to the Council today, include updates to the agreement with Ukraine to improve its practical implementation and enforcement while maintaining its objectives and scope.

title: Commission makes €1bn available for recharging and refuelling points under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF)
description: The Commission is launching a call for proposals under the Connecting Europe Facility – Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Facility (AFIF)

title: Public workshop: adoption of new ITS Working Programme 2024-2028
description: On 19 March 2024 the European Commission will organise a stakeholder workshop via videoconference to discuss the new Working Programme of the ITS Directive for the period 2024-2028.

title: Recording available: Academic conference on future of EU mobility and transport
description: On 21 February 2024, the European Commission organised an all-day academic conference on the state of play on EU transport policy and the challenges and priorities for the future of EU transport and mobility. In case you missed it, you can still watch the recording!

title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising ship inspections and oversight
description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council on updating the requirements for the Port State Control of vessels calling at EU ports, and on the flag State requirements for merchant vessels registered in EU Member States.

title: Extraordinary G7 Transport Ministerial welcomes EU maritime operation to safeguard Red Sea maritime security
description: G7 Transport Ministers expressed strong condemnation of the attacks carried out by the Houthis against commercial vessels and navy ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.

title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement on tackling ship-source pollution to help make European seas cleaner
description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement between the European Parliament and the Council on the amendment of Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for pollution offences.

title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising maritime accident investigations
description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached today between the European Parliament and the Council on the investigation of maritime accidents, modernising a 2009 Directive.

title: Focus on urban public transport – first set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
description: During its last plenary meeting on 16 January the Commission Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) adopted its first set of recommendations to the European Commission, primarily influenced by the recent work of the EGUM members on public transport and shared mobility.

title: EU and Moldova launch high-level dialogue on transport
description: In a bid to strengthen cooperation in the transport field, Commissioner Adina Vălean and Moldova’s Minister for Infrastructure and Regional Development Andrei Spînu today launched the EU-Moldova high-level dialogue on transport.

title: Commission proposes to modernise river information services in EU
description: The Commission adopted a proposal to improve traffic management on the EU’s rivers and canals.

title: Global Gateway: €10 billion commitment to invest in Trans Caspian Transport Corridor connecting Europe and Central Asia announced at Investors Forum
description: Executive Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis announced that European and international financial institutions present at the Forum will commit €10 billion in support and investments towards sustainable transport connectivity in Central Asia.

title: New report comparing air traffic management performance in Europe and the United States published
description: In the ongoing series of comparative reports between Europe and the US, the most recent update looks at operational as well as economic air traffic management (ATM) performance.

title: STF: Call for applications for new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and e-mobility Public Key Infrastructure
description: Sustainable Transport Forum – new calls for applications

title: Commission supports military mobility projects with €807 million
description: The Commission will fund 38 additional military mobility projects to support the transport of troops and equipment along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

title: New deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
description: Deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF) extended.

title: Save the date: Global TBO Symposium (4-6 June 2024)
description: Towards global trajectory-based operations (TBO)

title: European Commission workshop addresses key challenges in seafaring profession
description: Decarbonisation, digitalisation, social security and wellbeing at sea were the key topics on the agenda of the workshop for the seafaring profession on 17 January.

title: “Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World 2024
description: The “Europe for Aviation” partners, consisting of nine European aviation organisations working to promote the modernisation, sustainability, and resilience of a safe European aviation, will come together at Airspace World, from 19-21 March 2024 in Geneva, Switzerland.
